description.plain:
Liam James Payne (August 29, 1993 – October 16, 2024) was an English R&B-pop singer-songwriter. He made his debut as a singer when he auditioned as a solo artist for the British television series The X Factor in 2008. He reauditioned as a solo artist in 2010, where he was put into a group along with four other contestants, to form the boy band that would later become known as One Direction.

After joining One Direction, Payne, along with bandmates Niall Horan, Louis Tomlinson, Harry Styles and former bandmate Zayn Malik, released five commercially successful albums, performed on four worldwide tours, and won multiple awards, including several BRIT Awards and four MTV Video Music Awards. He also worked independently under the monikers “Big Payno” and “Payno”, creating remixes for songs such as British pop singer Cheryl’s single “I Don’t Care”.

When One Direction first announced their hiatus in 2016, Liam said that he would stay in the music, but not go into a solo singing career. On May 10, 2017, Liam announced the release of his debut single “Strip That Down”. It became one of the biggest-selling debuts of all time, one of the most streamed songs of Summer 2017, making it the biggest selling song by any member from One Direction at the time.

On October 16, 2024, Payne was reported dead after falling from a hotel balcony in Buenos Aires, Argentina.

songs.full_title: Strip That Down by Liam Payne (Ft. Quavo)
songs.title: Strip That Down

description.plain:
Singer-songwriter Liam Payne has been in the studio since the beginning of 2017 working on his solo music. He posted pictures of him on his social media while being in the studio.

At the beginning of May 2017, Hip-hop rapper Quavo from the Hip-Hop group Migos first teased the collaboration. He announced the collaboration during in an interview with Tim Westwood saying, “I just came from a video today. My boy Liam from One Direction. We just shot that. Crazy vid. Crazy visuals. Crazy team. Cool guy, nice guy. It’s goin’ up. I wasn’t even supposed to say that. It’s gonna be a surprise though. Surprise!"

On Wednesday, May 10, 2017, Liam posted on his social media a snippet of “Strip That Down” with beats of the song playing. With the caption of the “Eyes” emoji. A day later, on Thursday, May 11, 2017, Liam revealed the title of the song and rapper Quavo from the Hip-Hop group Migos will be featured on the track. The snippet of the song was Quavo singing his part of the lyrics, “Get down girl, love when you hit the ground, girl”.

Strip That Down is co-written by British singer-songwriter, Ed Sheeran who has worked with One Direction in the past as well. It was confirmed by Liam in an interview.

songs.full_title: For You by Liam Payne & Rita Ora
songs.title: For You

description.plain:
“For You” is a collaboration between popstars Liam Payne and Rita Ora for the final installment of the Fifty Shades of Grey trilogy, Fifty Shades Freed.

The collaboration is the successor to Liam Payne’s hit track, “Bedroom Floor” and is also the follow-up to Rita Ora’s “Anywhere.”

The track was first teased through Rita Ora’s Instagram post, and then was followed up by a teaser through Liam Payne’s Twitter account which included the hashtag “#ForYou.”

songs.full_title: Familiar by Liam Payne & J Balvin
songs.title: Familiar

description.plain:
“Familiar” by Liam Payne is his fifth single, and second of 2018, following his departure from the well-known boy band One Direction. The song features the well-established Colombian-born singer Jose (J.) Balvin, mostly known for his hit single “Mi Gente” featuring Willy William, later remixed with Beyonce.

The song oozes with the familiar sexual undertones of a typical club-setting, with Payne eager to get ‘familiar’ with the girl he already has eyes for.

songs.full_title: Both Ways by Liam Payne
songs.title: Both Ways

description.plain:
“Both Ways” is a moody R&B track that serves as the tenth track on Liam’s debut album LP1. The song explains how Liam’s significant other is bisexual and enjoys a three-way sex situation with another woman. Liam later goes on to explain how what turns her on turns him on as well, and that he will do anything to give her sexual pleasure.

The song wasn’t released until Liam’s debut album’s release date on December 6, 2019, but Liam did release a snippet of the song in January 2016 on Instagram.

Liam received some backlash to the song over allegations that the lyrics fetishize female bisexuality.

songs.full_title: Bedroom Floor by Liam Payne
songs.title: Bedroom Floor

description.plain:
Liam Payne’s second solo single is a callout to a girl who claims she has no feelings for him, although it’s clear to him that she does. Liam premiered the song on BBC Radio 1’s Breakfast Show with Nick Grimshaw on October 20th, 2017.

Before its official release, Liam posted an instrumental snippet on social media on October 16th, and a lyrical preview two days later.

The official music video featured Bella Thorne, who dated writer Charlie Puth in the past.

body.plain:
Liam Payne’s second solo single is a callout to a girl who claims she has no feelings for him, although it’s clear to him that she does. Liam premiered the song on BBC Radio 1’s Breakfast Show with Nick Grimshaw on October 20th, 2017.

Before its official release, Liam posted an instrumental snippet on social media on October 16th, and a lyrical preview two days later.

The official music video featured Bella Thorne, who dated writer Charlie Puth in the past.

description.plain:
“Stack It Up”  features playful lyrics and a guest verse from A Boogie wit da Hoodie. This is Liam’s first single released in 2019 and his sixth overall. The video features Boogie and Liam in an arcade, fitting with the video game sound in the beginning of the track.

Liam first mentioned this song while at his Hugo Boss capsule collection showing in Miami, Florida, saying that his next single was written by someone he’s collaborated with in the past, on May 2017’s “Strip That Down.”

https://pbs.twimg.com/media/EAnZvlEX4AchdyA?format=jpg&name=900x900

On August 10, 2019, the below was leaked, further adding to the suspense of the release:

https://pbs.twimg.com/media/EBtVpYFWkAE8kPV?format=jpg&name=900x900

songs.full_title: First Time by Liam Payne & French Montana
songs.title: First Time

description.plain:
First time is the title and name track to Liam’s first EP First Time. The music video for the song was released on September 20, 2018 even though it was never officially released as a single.

Prior to the release of the EP, liam posted on his social media accounts a phone number that fans could call every day up to the release (It started at five days prior to the release) and they would hear a snippet of each of the five songs on each day. https://twitter.com/LiamPayne/status/1032300016109608960

The song describes a situation alot like that in Drake’s “Hotline Bling,” Liam keeps his phone on and “picks up on the first time [ring]” every time she calls. Liam is close friends to Drake and has sung hotline bling on multiple occations, so this makes sense.

songs.full_title: Depend on It by Liam Payne
songs.title: Depend on It

description.plain:
This song goes through the beginning and end of a relationship. Liam states that they “…used to be lovin', touchin', kissin', f- like our lives depend on it” to “lyin', cryin', always fightin'Like our lives depend on it. An important thing to note about the song is that Liam doesn’t deliberately say the word "fuckin”, he kind of censors it out, this is because, once in an interview, Liam said he finds cursing in song’s pointless, plus he has a very young son whom he needs to set a good example for.

In the beginning of the song, Liam starts by saying that she is putting words in his mouth, and that’s she’s ready to break up, he isn’t.

In the middle Liam questions “do or don’t we find a way to get back that thing we used to have”.

Near the end, Liam says how he makes situations worse with “his wild words” but she is hiding something.

The reason why this song is so important to fans is because they had been asking Liam for a ballad, and they finally got it in such an emotional and raw way.
https://twitter.com/Payne_IsA_Saint/status/914718705229094913

description.plain:
“Remember” is a mellow song that takes the second spot on the tracklist of Liam Payne’s debut album, LP1.

In this song, Payne describes a relationship in which he is no longer in, explaining how he can’t forget the other person, as everything reminds him of them.

songs.full_title: Slow by Liam Payne
songs.title: Slow

description.plain:
This is the fourth and final track from Liam Payne’s First Time – EP.  It was orignally recorded in 2016, but not released until 2018.





Produced by Sylvester Siversten, Cutfather and MdL, who’ve collectively worked with the likes of The Chainsmokers, Olly Murs and Justin Bieber, “Slow” is about a relationship that Payne wants to revive, though it is destined to fail.

songs.title: Home with You

description.plain:
“Home With You” is an upbeat, poppy song featured on Liam’s first EP First Time.

It describes Liam being infatuated with a woman that he locks eyes with, he instantly is attracted to her and wants to learn more about her, setting a totally different mood for the album, describing the beginning of a possible relationship, while the sons “Depend On It” and “Slow” describe the end of a relationship.

songs.full_title: Tell Your Friends by Liam Payne
songs.title: Tell Your Friends

description.plain:
“Tell Your Friends” was first performed at a Japanese music festival Popspring in March 2018, and was the only previously unheard song to be performed in his set. It’s the first track where we hear Payne showing his rapping skills, even though he had previously teased it throughout multiple interviews.

Lyrically, “Tell Your Friends” is about Liam feeling the need to encourage his love interest to ignore the negative opinions of the people around them and instead be proud of their relationship.

songs.full_title: Heart Meet Break by Liam Payne
songs.title: Heart Meet Break

description.plain:
“Heart Meet Break” is the third song off of Liam Payne’s debut album LP1. The song fits the mood of the album by referencing to a relationship’s break up.

In this song, Liam refers to how “[love] always ends”, which is a common theme in Payne’s music — He has referenced a similar idea on songs like 2018’s “Depend On It”, on his first EP, First Time.

songs.full_title: Weekend by Liam Payne
songs.title: Weekend

description.plain:
Weekend has been referred to as “the most personal song on the album” in interviews. In the song, the weekend appears to symbolize Payne embracing his recklessness which is, ironically, the time when he feels most alive.

“It kind of outlines my struggle with mental health and different things that I had (experienced) living my life the way I used to,” he said, adding that the real-life events that inspired the song are “probably something I’ll never talk about fully.”

In the past, Payne has spoken about his struggles with bouts of alcohol dependency as a coping mechanism. The lyrics can be interpreted as a glimpse into what his mindset was like during one of the dark, self-destructive times in his life.

songs.full_title: Say It All by Liam Payne
songs.title: Say It All

description.plain:
In this song, Payne recognizes that both he and his partner are guilty of shutting each other out, resulting in a lack of communication.  He urges that they need to say it all and learn to be vulnerable if they want to make their relationship work.

The song was first alluded to by Ryan Tedder back in April 2017. “I’ve already done a song with Liam and I’m actually recording a second song with him next week. His stuff is spectacular,” he said. “Liam is pop, and doing it in a fantastic fashion. He has a killer voice.

songs.full_title: What Have You Done by Liam Payne (Ft. RITUAL)
songs.title: What Have You Done

description.plain:
A song writer from UK met Liam in 2019 through Mutual friends.. He was in a difficult place of his life after one direction break and the break up of his relationship.
They spoke for hours about what he’d been through in his life and and he (the song writer) wanted to help him try and express things he was bottling up.
The songwriter said: that he was incredibly kind and welcoming and they got on so well and he ended up stay with liam for a while in his house near malibu (this house was later sold to halsey)
He also said: liam had such crazy stories and such an unbelievable life.. He would tell me stories of being in 1D that blew my mind as exciting as it was i could tell it had taken so much out of him and for someone who had so much.. It felt like he was left with almost nothing
One night in his house we were talking about how much we both loved Oasis and we started playing these guitar chords…. Liam started to say really honest things about how he felt about himself and where he was in life… I told him to write them down and we had this melody… Listening to him sings these words today.. I’m so devastated he didn’t find the peace he was looking for
And he continues: I’ll never forget the kindness he showed me and the times we shared together.. He was a good person, so funny, would laugh at himself and do anything to make someone else laugh with him.. He just wanted to feel included and accepted and it breaks my heart he never felt that for himself

Later on the same day, the song release got delayed indefinitely with Sam Pounds declaring “its not the time yet”.

songs.full_title: Sunshine by Liam Payne
songs.title: Sunshine

description.plain:
On “Sunshine,” Liam Payne expresses his gratitude towards a person defined as his sunshine. The upbeat R&B song marks Liam’s first single of 2021. In an interview with MTV UK, Liam said:

This is the first song that I’ve written for myself, actually, which I struggled with for some time.

This is the second song of his featured on a soundtrack, the first being his collaboration with Rita Ora on “For You.” The song is featured in the 2021 movie Ron’s Gone Wrong, which concerns a teenager who has a robot that turns out to be defective. Liam also voices a minor character in the movie.

On inspiration for the song, Liam said:


We kind of had all the melodies and stuff done first and, as we knew we were writing a song for kids, one of the kids of one of the writers came into the room and we asked, “What did you think of the song?” And he was like, “I really like the song, I just wish it had more sunshine in it” and that’s where the title came from.

It was a two-part job for me. I’ve been a Disney fan since I was a kid so for me it was something I really wanted to work on, and then obviously for my son to hear my voice in the film is super cool.

songs.full_title: Bedroom Floor (NSG Remix) by Liam Payne (Ft. NSG)
songs.title: Bedroom Floor (NSG Remix)

description.plain:
Liam Payne hit the charts as a solo artist for the third time with his October 2017 release Bedroom Floor – an electropop track about a tumultuous breakup.

In late November 2017, a remix featuring British hip-hop group NSG was released. An accompanying music video was uploaded to Liam’s official youtube channel on December 19th, showing the 6-piece NSG and Liam in a studio amid shots of the crowd during a live NSG performance.

The remix discards the verses of the original version and instead introduces rapping from NSG following each chorus and the final pre-chorus.
